Evaluating Weak Memories with Maya
Divyakant Agrawal
Manhoi Choy
Hong Va Leong
Ambuj K. Singh
Department of Computer Science
University of California
at Santa Barbara
Santa Barbara, CA 93106
Abstract
Maya is a simulation platform for evaluating the performance of parallel programs on parallel archi-
tectures with dierent memory coherence protocols. Rapid prototyping of dierent memory protocols
supporting varying degrees of coherence is possible and the impact of these protocols on the performance
of application programs can be studied. Implementations of existing weak memories along with some
new primitives using Maya are presented. The results of running some user applications are summarized
and the impact of weak memories on the eciency of parallel programs is discussed.
Keywords: distributed shared memory, memory consistency, parallel programming, weak memories
